alert.note: Alert for Amelia; Dinwiddie; Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights); Powhatan; Western Chesterfield (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 11:15AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Chesterfield, northeastern Dinwiddie, southeastern Amelia and southeastern Powhatan Counties through NOON EDT... At 1114 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Moseley, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Reduced visibilty and minor flooding possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Chesterfield Court House around 1200 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Pocahontas State Park, Skinquarter, Beach, Winterpock, Addison, Holly Hills, Midlothian, Clayville and Chesterfield. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Amelia; Dinwiddie; Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights); Powhatan; Western Chesterfield
